content.question: Which of the following demographic patterns most directly contributed to the difference between women in the Chesapeake colonies and women in the New England colonies as described in the second paragraph of the excerpt?

choices.label: Former indentured servants in the Chesapeake were typically unable to marry because they could not acquire land and support a family.
More women chose to immigrate to New England than to the Chesapeake because New England was safer and life expectancy was longer.
Young, single men tended to immigrate to the Chesapeake, whereas families tended to immigrate to New England.
The greater number of women than men in New England forced women to move to frontier settlements in search of husbands.

content.answer: Young, single men tended to immigrate to the Chesapeake, whereas families tended to immigrate to New England.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
